Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Technique: ENAMELLED; ENGRAVED; PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL
Name: Scarab
Description: Scarab with the eyes, head and clypeus depicted. Two lateral incisions indicate the prothorax and diagonal lines  the legs. The base bears a spiral motif frequently encountered at the end of the Middle Kingdom, often called Hyksos.
